member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.MutationTestAttribute
member.summary: A marker attribute used to tell NinjaTurtles that the unit test to which it is applied is a mutation test. Such a test method should not be included in the list of detected tests that forms the suite of tests run in testing a particular code mutant.

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains core classes that are used to define and run mutation tests. The best starting point to see how this is done is the class.

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.ConsoleProcessFactory
member.summary: A factory class used to instatiate a instance, taking into account the operating system and runtime.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.ConsoleProcessFactory.CreateProcess(System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a instance used to execute the executable identifier by the parameter, with the specified.
member.param: The name (and path) of the executable to run.
The command line arguments to pass to the executable.
An optional list of additional search paths.
member.returns: An instance of .

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.MutationTestBuilder`1
member.summary: A static class used as the starting point for a fluent definition of a set of mutation tests.

example.para: This code creates and runs mutation tests for the ClassUnderTest class's MethodUnderTest method:

When this code is included in a test, it causes the matching tests to be run for each mutation that is found of the code under test. The matching tests are determined automatically by NinjaTurtles. By default, NinjaTurtles assumes it is running under NUnit, and thus uses an NUnit runner to run the suite against the mutated code. This can be changed using the fluent interface:
Alternatively, this option can be set across all tests in a fixture by including this line in the test fixture's setup method:

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.MutationTestBuilder`1.For(System.String,System.Type[])
member.summary: Returns an instance allowing a fluent definition of a set of mutation tests for a particular method.
member.param: The name of the method to mutate.
Optional parameter specifying an array of parameter types used to identify a particular method overload.
member.returns: An instance to allow fluent method chaining.

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.MutationTestBuilder
member.summary: A static class used as the starting point for a fluent definition of a set of mutation tests.
member.remarks: For public classes, the generic is to be prefered. See that class for full documentation.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.MutationTestBuilder.For(System.String,System.String,System.Type[])
member.summary: Returns an instance allowing a fluent definition of a set of mutation tests for a particular method.
member.param: The namespace-qualified name of the type for which mutation tests are being defined.
The name of the method to mutate.
Optional parameter specifying an array of parameter types used to identify a particular method overload.
member.returns: An instance to allow fluent method chaining.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.MutationTestBuilder.UseRunner``1
member.summary: Specifies the implementation of to be used to run the test suite for each mutant. By default, this will be the . This can still be overridden on a per-test basis using the method.

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.IMutationTest
member.summary: An interface forming the core of a fluent interface for defining and running mutation tests using NinjaTurtles.
member.remarks: Client code will not use this interface explicitly, nor attempt to instantiate an implementing class. Instead, this interface is exposed by the class's method, which forms the start of a chain of fluent statements defining a set of mutation tests.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.IMutationTest.Run
member.summary: Runs the defined mutation tests.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.IMutationTest.With``1
member.summary: Adds a type to be used in mutation testing. If no turtles are added, then all turtles from the NinjaTurtles assembly are added by default.
member.returns: The original instance to allow fluent method chaining.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.IMutationTest.UsingRunner``1
member.summary: Sets the unit test runner to be used, which is an implementation of . If none is specified, then the default is to use .
member.returns: The original instance to allow fluent method chaining.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.IMutationTest.WriteReportTo(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies a file name to which mutation test results should be written. If the file already exists, it will be overwritten.
member.param: The path and file name of the output file.
member.returns: The original instance to allow fluent method chaining.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.IMutationTest.MergeReportTo(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies a file name to which mutation test results should be written. If the file already exists, then the results of the current mutation test will be merged into it.
member.param: The path and file name of the output file.
member.returns: The original instance to allow fluent method chaining.

member.name: P:NinjaTurtles.IMutationTest.TargetType
member.summary: Gets the type which is the target of the current mutation test.

member.name: P:NinjaTurtles.IMutationTest.TargetMethod
member.summary: Gets the name of the method which is the target of the current mutation test.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.MutationTest.UsingRunner``1
member.summary: Sets the unit test runner to be used, which is an implementation of . If none is specified, then the default is to use .
member.returns: The original instance to allow fluent method chaining.

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.TestRunners.MSTestTestRunner
member.summary: An implementation of to run a unit test suite using the MSTest console runner.

example.para: This code creates and runs the default set of mutation tests for the ClassUnderTest class's MethodUnderTest method using the :

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.TestRunners.ITestRunner
member.summary: Interface defining core behavior of a unit test runner used by NinjaTurtles.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.TestRunners.ITestRunner.GetRunnerProcess(NinjaTurtles.TestDirectory,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary:
Runs the tests specified from the test assembly, found within the test directory identified in the provided instance.
This method won't be called from a user's testing code, it is called internally by NinjaTurtles, and is only exposed publicly to allow for a new implementation to be provided as an extension to NinjaTurtles.
member.param: The containing the test image.
The file name (with or without path) of the unit test assembly.
A list of qualified unit test names.
member.returns: A instance to run the unit test runner.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.TestRunners.MSTestTestRunner.GetRunnerProcess(NinjaTurtles.TestDirectory,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary:
Runs the tests specified from the test assembly, found within the test directory identified in the provided instance.
This method won't be called from a user's testing code, it is called internally by NinjaTurtles, and is only exposed publicly to allow for a new implementation to be provided as an extension to NinjaTurtles.
member.param: The containing the test image.
The file name (with or without path) of the unit test assembly.
A list of qualified unit test names.
member.returns: A instance to run the unit test runner.

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.TestRunners.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains the interface and some implementations of it, used to run test suites against generated mutants using different unit testing frameworks.

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.TestRunners.NUnitTestRunner
member.summary: An implementation of to run a unit test suite using the NUnit console runner.

example.para: This code creates and runs the default set of mutation tests for the ClassUnderTest class's MethodUnderTest method using the :
Alternatively, this can be omitted, since this is the default runner used by NinjaTurtles.

member.summary:
Runs the tests specified from the test assembly, found within the test directory identified in the provided instance.
This method won't be called from a user's testing code, it is called internally by NinjaTurtles, and is only exposed publicly to allow for a new implementation to be provided as an extension to NinjaTurtles.
member.param: The containing the test image.
The file name (with or without path) of the unit test assembly.
A list of qualified unit test names.
member.returns: A instance to run the unit test runner.

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.Turtles.ArithmeticOperatorTurtle
member.summary: An implementation of that replaces each of the arithmetic operators , , , and with each of the others in turn.

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.Turtles.OpCodeRotationTurtle
member.summary: An abstract base class for implementations of that operator by replacing a number of IL OpCodes with a list of replacements in turn.
member.remarks: Classes extending this one only need to set the value of the field to an appropriate dictionary of source and target OpCodes.

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.Turtles.MethodTurtleBase
member.summary: An abstract base class for implementations of .

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.Turtles.IMethodTurtle
member.summary: An interface defining basic functionality for a turtle that operates on the IL of a method body.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.Turtles.IMethodTurtle.Mutate(Mono.Cecil.MethodDefinition,NinjaTurtles.Module,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Returns an of detailed descriptions of mutations, having first carried out the mutation in question and saved the modified assembly under test to disk.
member.param: A for the method on which mutation testing is to be carried out.
A representing the main module of the containing assembly.
An array of the original IL offsets before macros were expanded.
member.returns: An of structures.

member.name: P:NinjaTurtles.Turtles.IMethodTurtle.Description
member.summary: Gets a description of the current turtle.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.Turtles.MethodTurtleBase.DoMutate(Mono.Cecil.MethodDefinition,NinjaTurtles.Module)
member.summary: Performs the actual code mutations, returning each with yield for the calling code to use.
member.remarks: Implementing classes should yield the result obtained by calling the method.
member.param: A for the method on which mutation testing is to be carried out.
A representing the main module of the containing assembly.
member.returns: An of structures.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.Turtles.MethodTurtleBase.DoYield(Mono.Cecil.MethodDefinition,NinjaTurtles.Module,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: A helper method that copies the test folder, and saves the mutated assembly under test into it before returning an instance of .
member.param: A for the method on which mutation testing is to be carried out.
A representing the main module of the containing assembly.
A description of the mutation that has been applied.
The index of the (first) IL instruction at which the mutation was applied.

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.MutationTestFailureException
member.summary: A custom exception type that is thrown to indicate a mutation test failure. Test frameworks that do not simply fail their tests on an exception being thrown can catch this exception type and act accordingly.

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.TestDirectory
member.summary: Represents a temporary directory used to contain a mutated assembly to be tested. The directory cleans up after itself when its method is called, unless its property is set to true.

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.Turtles.NamespaceDoc

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.Turtles.VariableReadTurtle
member.summary: An implementation of that identifies local variables, method parameters and fields of the same type, and permutes any reads from them. For example, if two parameters a and b exist, along with a local variable c of the same type, then a read from a will be replaced by one from b and c in turn, and so on.

member.name: M:NinjaTurtles.Turtles.VariableReadTurtle.DoMutate(Mono.Cecil.MethodDefinition,NinjaTurtles.Module)
member.summary: Performs the actual code mutations, returning each with yield for the calling code to use.
member.remarks: Implementing classes should yield the result obtained by calling the method.
member.param: A for the method on which mutation testing is to be carried out.
A representing the main module of the containing assembly.
member.returns: An of structures.

member.name: P:NinjaTurtles.Turtles.VariableReadTurtle.Description
member.summary: Gets a description of the current turtle.

member.name: T:NinjaTurtles.Turtles.VariableWriteTurtle
member.summary: An implementation of that identifies local variables of the same type, and permutes any assignments to them. For example, if two variables a and b exist, then an assignment to a will be replaced by one to b, and vice versa.
